Description: YapStone (VacationRentPayments) notifies some property managers and others who use their service to receive vacation rental payments that personal information in their account applications was compromised by unauthorized persons between July 15, 2014 and August 5, 2015.

Author: Iron Tiger
Target: US Government, US defense contractors and related companies in the US and abroad
Description: Trend Micro unveils the details of Operation Iron Tiger, a high-level operation observed stealing trillions of bytes of confidential data from the United States government, US defense contractors and related companies in the United States and abroad.

Author: ?(China?)
Target: Russian military personnel and Russian telecoms
Description: Proofpoint reveals the details of a campaign targeting Russian military personnel and Russian telecoms employees via a variant of the PlugX RAT.

Author:
w0rm
(hacking crew)
Description: The w0rm hacking crew, operators of a forum of the same name, have attack a rival gang, Monopoly, and offer the database of their rivals for sale on their forum.

Author: NetPirates
Target:
Malabar Institute of Medical Sciences
http://www.mimsindia.com/
Description: The NetPirates hack the Malabar Institute of Medical Sciences (mimsindia.com) and dump 6,709 usernames and clear text passwords.
Tags: NetPirates, Malabar Institute of Medical Sciences, mimsindia.com

Author: The Dukes
Description: F-Secure reveals the details of The Dukes, a Russian speaking actor behind a seven years campaign of targeted attacks against the United States, Europe and Asia.
Apple officials clean up the company's App Store after several security firms report that almost 40 iOS apps contain malicious code
Attack:
XcodeGhost
(malicious version of Apple Xcode IDE)

Target:
Red Hat Projects:
Ceph community project (ceph.com)
Inktank (download.inktank.com)
Description: Red Hat reveals to have suffered an intrusion on the sites of both the Ceph community project (ceph.com) and Inktank (download.inktank.com) that resulted in signed code being accessed.
Tags: Red Hat, Ceph, ceph.com, Inktank, download.inktank.com

Description: Commack school district computer district is hacked by an unknown individual.
Forbes is notified of a malvertising campaign on its website running from 8 to 15 September. The company states to have removed the offending ads.

Target: Online Poker sites including PokerStars and Full Tilt Poker
Description: ESET unveils the details of  Win32/Spy.Odlanor, a malware used by its malware operator to cheat in online poker by peeking at the cards of infected opponents. It specifically targets two of the largest online poker sites: PokerStars and Full Tilt Poker.
Tags: ESET, Win32/Spy.Odlanor, PokerStars, Full Tilt Poker

Author: Opheus Haxor
Description: Opheus Haxor hacks the forum section of j-ax.it (the website of one of the most Italian singers) and dumps 31,000 usernames.

Author: Anonymous
Target:
Embarcadero Group
Palo Alto Weekly
Mountain View Voice
Pleasanton Weekly
The Almanac
Description: An individual or group claiming to be the hacktivist collective Anonymous shuts down all websites operated by Embarcadero Media Group, which runs several community newspapers in the Bay Area. The media group’s newspapers include: Palo Alto Weekly, Mountain View Voice, Pleasanton Weekly and The Almanac.
Tags: Anonymous, Embarcadero Media Group, Palo Alto Weekly, Mountain View Voice, Pleasanton Weekly, The Almanac

Target: A large number of Wordpress sites
Description: Sucuri reveals a massive Wordpress campaign redirecting the visitors of the infected sites to a Nuclear Exploit Kit landing page.

Author: Horux
Description: Kettering General Hospital reveals that its email system is compromised by a Russian hacking group, that used it to send spam.

Author: Hack for Trump
Description: A group of hackers that calls itself “Hack for Trump” claims to have hacked the website of Fidelity Group and threaten it would make the stolen data public unless Fidelity pays $30,000. The hackers plan to use the funds "to help Donald Trump get elected to the White House".
Tags: Hack for Trump, Fidelity Group Donald Trump

Author: @W0x404
Description: An individual with the moniker of @W0x404 claims to have hacked several French-speaking marketplaces of questionable goods inside the Darknet. As proof of his actions, the attacker dumps several screenshots.

Author: ElliotAlderson
Description: ElliotAlderson hacks asankadr.az and dumps 5,926 usernames and hashed passwords.

Author:
AntiSec
HagashTeam
Description: Two hacktivists affiliated to Anonymous, AntiSec and HagashTeam, deface 8 Vietnamese government websites against online censorship and human rights violations in the country.

Author: ?(China?)
Description: Check Point Software unveils the details of a new malicious app uploaded in Google Play in disguise of a Brain Test app. The malware could have infected at least 200,000 Android phones, possibly as many as 1 million.
Tags: Check Point Software, Google Play, Brain Test

Description: Frank J. Martin Company notifies an undisclosed number of individuals who made purchases on the Padlocks4Less website that their personal information, including payment card data, may have been accessed without authorization.

Author: Anonymous
Description: The website of the Philippines' National Telecom Commission (NTC), ntc.gov.ph, is defaced by the local branch of the Anonymous in a form of protest against the slow local Internet connection average speed.
Tags: Philippines' National Telecom Commission, NTC, Anonymous, ntc.gov.ph

Description: Yet another high-profile website victim of a malvertising campaign. This time the target is realtor.com, a popular real estate website realtor.com, ranked third in its category with an estimated 28 million monthly visits.

Author: ?(China?)
Target:
U.S. Government entity
European media company
Description: A report from Palo Alto Networks confirms Chinese cyber attacks on a U.S. government entity and a European media company. The attacks, using a malware called '3102' were observed respectively on May 6, 2015 and May 11, 2015.

Author: Smitt3nz
Description: Smitt3nz hacks the-athenaeum.org and dumps 1,671 users with hashed passwords.

Target: Adult portals, including top domain xHamster.com
Description: Malwarebytes reveals the latest developments of the malvertising campaign plaguing primary domains such as Yahoo.com, MSN.com since August. Now the time the campaign is targeting several adult portals such as xHamster.com. The malicious advertising is served by TrafficHaus.
Imgur, the photo-sharing website, is exploited in a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack on the popular imageboards 4chan and 8chan.

Author: NetPirates
Description: The NetPirates hack dresscloud.pl and dump 5,269 usernames and hashed passwords.

Author: Anonymous
Description: As part of their vendetta against the Canadian government, hackers claiming to belong to the Anonymous collective leak another high-level confidential federal document.

Multiple sources in the banking industry say they have traced a pattern of credit card fraud that suggests hackers have compromised point-of-sale registers in gift shops and restaurants at a large number of Hilton Hotel and franchise properties across the United States.

North Oldham High School alerts 2,800 current and former students that a data breach earlier this month could have exposed their names, social security numbers and other personal information after a school computer falls victim of a drive-by attack.

APEGA, the body that regulates engineers and geologists in Alberta reports a "significant data breach" when all the names and email addresses of its 75,000 members are given to an unknown party as a result of a phishing event.
The Big Blue Bus alerts customers of a potential data breach related to the NextBus program

Author: Team Pak Cyber Attacker
Target:
Official website of Kerala Government:
http://www.kerala.gov.in
Description: A Pakistani hacker dubbed Pakistan Zindabad defaces two websites belonging to the Kerala Government.

Author: The Mallu Cyber Soldiers
Target: 46 Pakistan websites, which include Pakistan’s government website Pakistan.gov.pk, president.gov.pk and cabinet.gov.pk
Description: In retaliation for the defacement of the Website of Kerala Government, an anonymous group called ‘Mallu Cyber Soldiers’ defaces around 46 Pakistan websites, which include Pakistan’s government website Pakistan.gov.pk, president.gov.pk and cabinet.gov.pk.

Author: Ghost Italy
Description: In name of #OpBankDump, Ghost Italy, a local cell of the Anonymous collective, hacks Banca Intesa and Unipol Banca, two of the most important Italian Banks, and leaks several databases, mainly related to external contractors.
Tags: Banca Intesa, Unipol Banca, #OpBankDump, Anonymous, Ghost Italy

Description: The employee records of a number of University of Calgary staff members are fraudulently accessed, and banking records altered, during an ‘isolated breach’.

Author: mr_xenon
Description: A hacker with the moniker mr_xenon hacks spelapoker.se and dumps 18606 records.

Author: Gaza Cybergang
Target: Government Entities in Egypt, United Arab Emirates and Yemen
Description: Kaspersky Lab unveils the details of the so-called "Gaza Cybergang", a group active since 2012 and targeting mainly governmental entities.

The Trump Hotel Collection acknowledges a malware infection across the United States and Canada, potentially stealing customer credit card data for an entire year. The list of hotels includes two locations in New York and one in each of the following cities: Chicago, Honolulu, Las Vegas, Toronto and Miami.

Author: Exfocus
Description: A hacker known under the moniker Exfocus takes down the Rutgers University

Author: SuperExtremeShitpostingTeam
Description: Patreon, the website that allows people to maintain regular donations to a website, an artist, or project, announces to have suffered a security breach. The site says some registered names, e-mail addresses, and mailing addresses were accessed after someone managed to access a “debug version of our website” that at the time was accessible to the public. Unfortunately the attackers leak Gigabyte of data.
Australian discount homewares chain Kmart is under investigation, following a data breach that occurred in early September which saw the personal details of its online customers hacked.

Several Thai government websites are hit by a suspected DDoS attack, making them impossible to access. It appears to be a protest against the government's plan to limit access to sites deemed inappropriate, dubbed the "Great Firewall of Thailand".

Author: 0x0D1337
Description: 0x0D1337 hacks dutchwow.com (a private World of Warcraft server) and dumps 3,917 records containing usernames and hashed passwords.

Author: KelvinSecTeam
Description: KelvinSecTeam hacks seniat.gov.ve and dumps 1,651 users with clear text passwords.
